sn7.12:1.2: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, went to the home of the brahmin Udaya.
sn7.12:1.3: Then Udaya filled the Buddha’s bowl with rice.
sn7.12:1.4: The next day … and the day after that … Udaya filled the Buddha’s bowl with rice.
sn7.12:1.5: But when he had filled the Buddha’s bowl for a third time, he said to the Buddha,
sn7.12:1.6: “This insatiable ascetic Gotama keeps coming back again and again!”
sn7.12:2.1: “Again and again, they sow the seed;
sn7.12:2.2: again and again, the lord god sends rain;
sn7.12:2.3: again and again, farmers plough the field;
sn7.12:2.4: again and again, grain is produced for the nation.
sn7.12:3.1: Again and again, the beggars beg;
sn7.12:3.2: again and again, the donors give.
sn7.12:3.3: Again and again, when the donors have given,
sn7.12:3.4: again and again, they take their place in heaven.
sn7.12:4.1: Again and again, dairy farmers milk;
sn7.12:4.2: again and again, a calf cleaves to its mother;
sn7.12:4.3: again and again, oppressing and intimidating;
sn7.12:4.4: that idiot is reborn again and again.
sn7.12:5.1: Again and again, you’re reborn and die;
sn7.12:5.2: again and again, you get carried to a charnel ground.
sn7.12:5.3: But when they’ve gained the path for no further rebirth,
sn7.12:5.4: one of vast wisdom is not reborn again and again.”
sn7.12:6.1: When he had spoken, the brahmin Udaya said to the Buddha,
sn7.12:6.3: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
